poem:
**Greenland mumbles in the silence of ice**

The frost whispers  
beneath JD's fleeting wings,  
Denmark's lullaby falters  
to the winds of drifting sheets.  
  
Absence speaks loud  
in the cold glow,  
where shadows of  
giant nations  
dance.  
  
Greenland sleeps  
wrapped in centuries—  
a snow-coiled  
dream.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "JD Vance says Denmark ‘has not done a good job by the people of Greenland’ – Europe live 6.57pm GMT And JD Vance is back on the plane and soon will be on the way back to the US. But the fallout from this visit will continue for much longer. 6.55pm GMT US threat assessment on Greenland – notes For what it’s worth, as context to Vance’s words on Chinese and Russian threat to Greenland,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
